executiveSummary: Christa Woods pitched her company, Glovesticks, seeking $150,000 for 10% equity to address odor problems in sports gear through patented antibacterial and moisture-absorbing sticks. After negotiations, Lori Greiner and Alex Rodriguez partnered to invest $150,000 for a combined 17% and 12% equity share, impressed by Christa’s drive and the product’s market potential.
keyDecisions: Lori Greiner and Alex Rodriguez agreed to invest $150,000 for a combined 29% equity (17% Lori, 12% Alex) in Glovesticks.

actionItems.task: Finalize partnership terms and investment paperwork between Christa Woods, Lori Greiner, and Alex Rodriguez.
Develop a business scaling plan with delegation strategy under Lori and Alex’s mentorship.
Leverage Alex Rodriguez’s sports connections to expand Glovesticks’ presence in athletic markets.

nextSteps: Christa will work with Lori and Alex to formalize the deal, begin scaling operations, and expand product distribution leveraging their expertise and networks.
